item.title: H.J. add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: H.J. add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "We are cups, constantly and quietly being filled. The trick is, knowing how to tip ourselves over and let the beautiful stuff out." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: H.J. add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: H.J. add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library." -- Jane Austen

item.title: H.J. add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Silly things do cease to be silly if they are done by sensible people in an impudent way." -- Jane Austen

item.title: H.J. add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: H.J. add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: H.J. add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: H.J. add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Cut out all these exclamation points. An exclamation point is like laughing at your own joke." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: H.J. add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "All good writing is like swimming underwater and holding your breath." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: H.J. add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "My mother... she is beautiful, softened at the edges and tempered with a spine of steel. I want to grow old and be like her." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: H.J. add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "If you have a sister and she dies, do you stop saying you have one? Or are you always a sister, even when the other half of the equation is gone?" -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: H.J. add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "When you love someone you let them take care of you." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: H.J. add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "I am not absentminded. It is the presence of mind that makes me unaware of everything else." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: H.J. add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Literature is a luxury; fiction is a necessity." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: H.J. add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "The most effective way to destroy people is to deny and obliterate their own understanding of their history." -- George Orwell

item.title: H.J. add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "Pirates could happen to anyone." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: H.J. add a quote by T. S. Eliot
item.description: "We shall not cease from exploration And the end of all our exploring Will be to arrive where we started And know the place for the first time." -- T. S. Eliot

item.title: H.J. add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Every man with a little leisure and enough money for railway tickets, every man, indeed, who knows how to read, has it in his power to magnify himself, to multiply the ways in which he exists, to make his life full, significant and interesting." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: H.J. add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: H.J. add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "I wanted to change the world. But I have found that the only thing one can be sure of changing is oneself." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: H.J. add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "...It all seemed to him to have disappeared as if behind a curtain at a theater. There are such curtains that drop in life. God is moving on to the next act." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: H.J. add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: H.J. add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The love of knowledge is a kind of madness." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: H.J. add a quote by Simone de Beauvoir
item.description: "She was ready to deny the existence of space and time rather than admit that love might not be eternal." -- Simone de Beauvoir

item.title: H.J. add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "He never went out without a book under his arm, and he often came back with two." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: H.J. add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "Time is the longest distance between two places." -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: H.J. add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "I know not all that may be coming, but be it what it will, I'll go to it laughing." -- Herman Melville

item.title: H.J. add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "It is not down on any map; true places never are." -- Herman Melville

item.title: H.J. add a quote by H.G. Wells
item.description: "For after the Battle comes quiet." -- H.G. Wells
